discoverType.title: Discover type
discoverType.description: Defines how task discovery will be performed. Use None to skip the discovery. Use HTTP Request to make a REST call to discover tasks. Use Item List to enumerate items for collect to retrieve. Use JSON Response to manually define discover tasks as a JSON array of objects. Each entry returned by the discover operation will result in a collect task.

itemList.title: Discover items
itemList.description: Comma-separated list of items to return from the Discover task. Each item returned will generate a collect task, and can be referenced using `${id}` in the collect URL, headers, or parameters.

attribute.title: Response attribute
attribute.description: Name(s) of the attribute(s) within the response that contains next-page information

maxPages.title: Max pages
maxPages.description: The maximum number of pages to retrieve, set to 0 to retrieve all pages

lastPageExpr.title: Last-page expression
lastPageExpr.description: Optional JS expression used to determine when the last page has been reached. The values tested by this expression must be present in the Response attributes section above. Example: morePages === false.

attribute.title: Response attribute
attribute.description: Name(s) of the header attribute(s) that contain next-page information

maxPages.description: The maximum number of pages to retrieve, set to 0 to retrieve all pages

nextRelationAttribute.title: Next page relation name
nextRelationAttribute.description: Relation name used in the link header that refers to the next page in the result set. In this example link header, rel="next" to the next page of results: <https://myHost/curPage>; rel="self" <https://myHost/nextPage>; rel="next"

curRelationAttribute.title: Current page relation name
curRelationAttribute.description: Optional relation name used in the link header that refers to the current result set. In this example link header, rel="self" refers to the current page of results: <https://myHost/curPage>; rel="self" <https://myHost/nextPage>; rel="next"

maxPages.title: Max pages
maxPages.description: The maximum number of pages to retrieve, set to 0 to retrieve all pages

offsetField.title: Offset field name
offsetField.description: Query string parameter that sets the index from which to begin returning records. E.g.: /api/v1/query?term=cribl&limit=100&offset=0

offset.title: Starting offset
offset.description: Offset index from which to start request. Defaults to undefined, which will start collection from the first record.

limitField.title: Limit field name
limitField.description: Query string parameter to set the number of records retrieved per request. E.g.: /api/v1/query?term=cribl&limit=100&offset=0

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of records to collect per request.

totalRecordField.title: Total record count field name
totalRecordField.description: Identifies the attribute in the response that contains the total number of records for the query.

maxPages.title: Max pages
maxPages.description: The maximum number of pages to retrieve. Set to 0 to retrieve all pages.

zeroIndexed.title: Zero-based index
zeroIndexed.description: Toggle to Yes to indicate that the first record in the requested data is at index 0. The default (No) indicates index 1.

pageField.title: Page number field name
pageField.description: Query string parameter that sets the page index to be returned. E.g.: /api/v1/query?term=cribl&page_size=100&page_number=0

page.title: Starting page number
page.description: Page number from which to start request. Defaults to undefined, which will start collection from the first page.

sizeField.title: Page size field name
sizeField.description: Query string parameter to set the number of records retrieved per request. E.g.: /api/v1/query?term=cribl&page_size=100&page_number=0

size.title: Page size
size.description: Maximum number of records to collect per page.
